ratings.comment: I totally get what the other person was saying, I agree it took Sig a while to get us feedback on papers this semester. That said, he was far and away the best Ta I've had, not even close. I also just want to say I think he uses humor really effectively in the classroom, and I thought that that was a really good way to teach a contentious subject.

I get the sense he was balancing a lot but it took him a pretty long time to get grades in from early in the semester. It made it a little harder to see where I was at until it was almost too late. Still really enjoyed discussion, he's great at taking complex ideas and sharing short cuts to understand them better.
Love Sig! Electrifies the room for every discussion.   He does keep us late though (Sig, if you read this, let us out on time!).
Ok, he's great. Had him during an early morning section but this dude was absolutely hilarious, like standup-level funny. It really made the class better and I appreciated that.
I liked this guy. A lot. I think it all came down to communication ability because sig knows how to talk to students without making them feel stupid. Hands down one of my best instructors in polisci.

Sig was such a goof, but also very organized and clearly knew the material. He would have us work in groups during discussion to draft notes of the readings for the week, and put these in a shared folder so we could review the notes around exams.

Great teacher, I really enjoyed discussion. He was pretty lenient with absences as long as they were excused beforehand and made up later. He would often experiment with different class formats like debates. He took us outside for class on a really nice day and the class really appreciated that. Often kept us a few minutes past the end of class.

I took this course because its one of the intro courses for the political science major, and I think I was pretty lucky to have Prof. Mayer and Sig as my teachers. Sig's all over the place but brings a lot of energy discussion. I felt like he really looked out for me when I was having trouble with class. Office hours were super helpful too.

Sig is quite the character! He's very creative and often switched up section. Attendance is very important, though he will work with you if you have conflicts, you just need to contact ahead of time. It may have just been this class but the readings and lecture slides were very important, and discussion was well organized but mostly supplemental.

Sig is a great teacher, and clearly cares about his students. I've attended his office hours a few times in the semester, and we always go down fun tangents on various policy topics. He also shares a lot of campus opportunities with his students, and took the time to help me declare my Political Science major.

I took this class in the fall before graduation because it was required for my major and really did not enjoy the content. That said, I think Sig was a very good TA and am glad I had him. I think he was actually younger than me which was kind of funny.

Signe was good at talking to students outside of class. He held a lot of office hours for students in his sections over the semester. Sometimes he is a little eccentric in discussion but it makes class more fun.

Would have added more positive tags if I could have. Sig is the reason I passed this class, to be honest. Willing to stay after class, meet for additional office hours, work through difficult concepts. Also spoke a lot about some of the issues he cares deeply about, and how he translates that into social science research.
